title: Wolves spoil Jokic's 61-point triple-double in 2OT
content: The Timberwolves overcame a career- and NBA-best 61-point triple-double performance from Nikola Jokic to outlast the Nuggets 140-139 in double overtime on Tuesday night.

title: Curry drops 52 in wild win vs. Grizz: 'Tank is full'
content: Stephen Curry had 52 points and 12 3-pointers as the Warriors held on for a wild 134-125 win over the Grizzlies on Tuesday night.

title: Ovechkin nets No. 891, four shy of NHL history
content: Washington captain Alex Ovechkin scored his 891st career goal, moving him four away from passing Wayne Gretzky's NHL record, and Dylan Strome broke a third-period tie Tuesday night to lead the first-place Capitals to a 4-3 victory over the Boston Bruins.

title: Bucks catch fire, shoot highest FG% this century
content: The Bucks snapped a four-game skid by shooting 68.9% from the field Tuesday night against the Suns, the highest single-game percentage by any team this century.

title: Campbell reunites with Cards for 18th NFL season
content: Six-time Pro-Bowl defensive lineman Calais Campbell has finalized a one-year deal to return to the Arizona Cardinals for his 18th NFL season, the team announced.

title: Stanton won't blame ailing elbows on torpedo bats
content: Yankees slugger Giancarlo Stanton declined Tuesday to say whether he believes using the torpedo bats last season caused the elbow ailments that have sidelined him this season.

title: Roy: Duclair 'god-awful' during Isles' 4-1 loss
content: In the heat of the Eastern Conference playoff race, and with his team struggling, New York Islanders coach Patrick Roy said Anthony Duclair was "god-awful" in a loss to the Tampa Bay Lightning, and that the veteran is failing to meet expectations.

title: Dodgers' 7-0 start ties 1933 Yanks as May returns
content: With Dustin May on the mound for the first time in more than 22 months, the Dodgers came from behind to beat the Braves 3-1 on Tuesday night and improve to 7-0, tying the 1933 Yankees for the best start to a season by a reigning World Series champion.

title: Everything we heard at NFL league meetings: QB options, draft maneuvers, roster holes
content: Annual NFL owners meetings wrapped up Tuesday, and more than 20 of our reporters on the ground had all the buzz from Palm Beach.

title: What's going on with Rafael Devers? Putting his historic strikeout streak into context
content: Boston's designated hitter has struck out 15 times and has no hits through the first five games. Here's what history tells us about his bad start.

title: Pain Index: Where do Arkansas, Purdue, other second-weekend losses rank?
content: Some losses are understandable; others will haunt us forever. Let's rank the 2025 men's NCAA tournament defeats, from least to most devastating.

title: Two weeks left in the NBA season! Answering the biggest questions

title: NBA play-in tournament 2025: Schedule, standings, format
content: Everything you need to know about the play-in tournament, including how it works, who's playing and when.

title: Inside the Grizzlies' shocking firing of Taylor Jenkins
content: The Grizzlies believe this firing will help reconnect the team's tantalizing core -- and reignite Ja Morant. But in truth, this dismissal began with five other ones nearly a year ago.

title: Bukayo Saka's return provides a glimmer of hope in Arsenal's injury-riddled season
content: Bukayo Saka made his return for Arsenal after three months, making an instant impact and giving Mikel Arteta's Gunners hope for what lies ahead.

title: Anthony Elanga is proof of how Man United desperately need to improve transfer strategy
content: Man United have seen more players leave and find success than those still at the club now. That must change.

content: How does a buzzer-beater come to be? A little strategy, a lot of luck, and the right player at the right time.

content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas are bound for Tampa, as well as 2-seed UConn. Who will reach the title game?

content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to the Final Four. But 2-seed UConn tops our list.

content: After the Yankees' home run barrage with bats that look like bowling pins, the innovation is sweeping baseball.

title: Amorim: I won't get much time to fix Utd woes
content: Ruben Amorim insisted he will not be given much time to turn things around as Manchester United manager, as his team slumped to another defeat at Nottingham Forest on Tuesday.

title: Arteta 'worried' by Arsenal's fresh injury crisis
content: Arsenal face a potential injury crisis in defense ahead of their Champions League showdown with Real Madrid after Gabriel Magalhães and Jurriën Timber picked up injuries in Tuesday's Premier League win over Fulham.

title: Messi fit as Miami eyes 'big step' into semifinals

title: Carlo: Madrid made final despite 'a lot of mistakes'

title: St. Pauli fans pay $29M for majority of club stadium
content: St. Pauli supporters have raised over 27 million euros (29.1 million) for a majority stake in the club's stadium after taking part in German soccer's first fan cooperative.

title: Messi's bodyguard no longer on Miami sidelines
content: Lionel Messi's bodyguard Yassine Cheuko said he has been banned from protecting the Argentina forward from the touchline during Inter Miami matches.

content: In an exclusive interview with ESPN, Harry Kane said he is unsure about a Premier League return and said he is already playing at the highest level.

title: 3rd-tier Bielefeld dump champs Bayer from cup

title: Vermes' Sporting KC exit marks end of a managerial era in MLS

title: Letting Salah leave for free could be one of Liverpool's biggest mistakes ever

title: Disability associations urge T.N. govt. to hike monthly allowance of persons with disabilities
content: Stating that the Andhra Pradesh government provides a pension of ₹6,000 to persons with disabilities, disability rights activist Smitha Sadasivan said that as living costs increase, PwDs require more support

title: Employees entitled to 42-day special casual leave for organ donation: Centre
content: Irrespective of the type of surgery for removal of a donor's organ, the duration of special casual leave will be a maximum of 42 days

content: ₹50,000 crore investments are estimated when the 400 acres land is fully occupied and operational, as per a note

title: “When a person is starving, does he go to a library?” Supreme Court disposes of plea for libraries in villages

title: T.N. CM Stalin writes to PM Modi urging complete withdrawal of Waqf (Amendment) Bill
content: The proposed amendments to the Waqf Act, 1995, have not taken into consideration the constitutional protection given to minorities and are bound to severely harm the interests of the Muslim community, he said

title: Nilgiris bandh: Shops shut in protest against e-pass system ordered by Madras High Court

title: T.N. Assembly unanimously adopts resolution on Katchatheevu retrieval from Sri Lanka

title: BJP seeks apology from Speaker for suspending 18 MLAs for six months in Karnataka
content: BJP claims that, as per an SC order in 2022, the Assembly can suspend MLAs for a limited period necessary to restore order in the House, but not for six months

title: Gujarat firecracker blast: Bodies of deceased taken to villages in Madhya Pradesh

title: Government loses ₹1,757 crore as BSNL fails to bill Reliance Jio for sharing infra: CAG
content: “BSNL failed to enforce the Master Service Agreement (MSA) with M/s. Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd (RJIL) and did not bill for the additional technology used on BSNL’s shared passive infrastructure, resulting in loss of Rs 1,757.76 crore and penal interest thereon, between May 2014 to March 2024 to the government exchequer,” CAG said

title: Bihar govt’s reply to frequent bridge collapses is a ‘voluminous’ litany of its popular schemes, policies, says SC
content: The counsel for the State said over 10,000 bridges were constructed, however, petitioner-advocate Brajesh Singh said “the State was only intent on constructing bridges without any mechanism to examine them”.

content: The amendment seeks to reform the 1995 Waqf Act by enhancing the Centre’s regulatory authority over waqf properties

title: Green future for whom?: Revisiting the marginalised lives of Challakere and Pavagada
content: While clean energy is inevitable for a sustainable future, what shouldn’t be ignored is the unequal distribution of burdens of climate action on the poor and marginalised of rural India, argues Bhargavi S. Rao, educator, researcher and former trustee at Environment Support Group

title: Why India needs to clean its air
content: India’s clean air future will be shaped not by dashboards but by people, partnerships, and purpose. Lasting solutions depend on those working on the ground: municipal officers, planners, engineers, and community leaders

title: BMTC achieves record 39.8% ticket revenue through UPI
content: On February 8, BMTC achieved a significant milestone as the digital payment (UPI) for tickets crossed ₹1 crore in a single day.

title: AIMPLB appeals to secular parties, MPs to oppose Waqf bill, vote against it

content: In a statement, Director of School Education V. Vijay Rama Raju said out of 6,24,742 students registered for the Social Studies examination across the State, 6,17,333 students appeared, while 7,409 were absent

title: Reduced toll charges between Hyderabad and Vijayawada

title: Panel to ensure smooth implementation of free education for poor children in private schools
content: A State-level committee will determine ‘per-child’ expenditure to be met by the government for students admitted to private schools under the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009.

title: TMC leaders question party’s ‘silence’ on SFI’s protests against Mamata at Oxford

title: Only One US President Served More Than 2 Terms. Here's Why
content: Only one person, Franklin Delano Roosevelt, has ever served more than two terms as president of the United States. This is for two reasons.

title: Video: Dog's Near-Death Experience On Railway Station Sparks Heated Debate
content: A viral video shows a dog nearly being hit by a train after its owner rushes to catch the train. The incident sparked online debates about pet responsibility, with some criticizing the owner, while others defended him for his efforts to save the dog.

title: Argument After Delhi Metro Commuter Refuses To Give Up Seat, Internet Reacts
content: Avideo has surfaced showing a heated argument between a man and a group of women in a crowded Delhi Metro on the Blue Line near Janakpuri West.

title: US Tops Forbes Billionaires List 2025. India With 205 Billionaires Ranks...
content: The United States remains the billionaire capital of the world with 902 names on the Forbes Billionaires List 2025. India has retained the third spot after adding five more billionaires to its last year tally of 200.

title: Can Studio Ghibli Sue OpenAI Over AI-Generated Images? What Lawyer Says
content: The lawyer said that OpenAI could face legal challenges for training its AI models on copyrighted works belonging to Studio Ghibli

title: Woman's Ghibli-Style Makeover Goes Wrong. She Gets A Third Hand
content: The internet has found its latest obsession: the Ghibli trend. Thanks to OpenAI's newest image-generation tool, social media users, including celebrities and politicians, are transforming their pictures into dreamy, Studio Ghibli-style animations.

title: Maharashtra Cabinet approves e-bike taxis, mineral foundation in Gadchiroli district

title: Allies support Waqf Bill, JD(U) urges government to not implement with retrospective effect

title: GST gross collections for 2024-2025 touch ₹44,825 crore
content: The net GST collections in March 2025 reached ₹3,116 crore, marking the highest amount collected in the past 11 months and the second highest in the year, said Chief Commissioner of Tax Babu A.

content: Experts emphasise the need for continuous support from parents and teachers to help adolescents on the autism spectrum understand and adjust to puberty changes

title: Law enforcement should be aware of changes in country: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: At the D.P. Kohli Memorial Lecture, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told law enforcement agencies that they needed to collaborate more with academia, startups, and industry

title: Bombay High Court denies bail to school bus driver for sexually assaulting a minor

title: Opposition hail SC order on demolitions in U.P., push for strict regulations

title: Delhi HC faults Centre for not following due process in OCI card holder blacklisting case
content: Govt. says the petitioner was denied entry because he had been blacklisted by security agencies on account of his involvement in missionary activities in Nagaland and other northeastern States without obtaining special permission from the competent authority

title: Ranya’s mother moves Karnataka High Court for preserving CCTV camera footage of her daughter at airport
content: Justice M. Nagaprasanna, before whom the petition came up for hearing, has adjourned further hearing on the petition till Wednesday

title: 'Badnaam hue to kia hua': Pastor converted to Christianity during jail term
content: Self-styled preacher Bajinder Singh, originally convicted for murder and later converted to Christianity, has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Punjab court for a 2018 rape case. Known for his claims of miraculous healing, Singh's ministry faced scrutiny after a 22-year-old woman accused him of sexual harassment, stalking, and criminal intimidation, leading to widespread controversy.

title: Waqf Bill to be named UMEED: Kiren Rijiju in LS
content: The BJP-led central government tabled the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in Parliament amid opposition from the INDIA bloc, incorporating suggestions from the Joint Parliamentary Committee. Union minister Kiren Rijiju defended the reforms, citing extensive consultations and emphasizing no interference in religious institutions, while Congress accused the Centre of rushing the legislation.

title: Sanju Samson cleared by CoE to keep wickets; set to return as RR captain
content: Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson is set to resume his wicketkeeping and captaincy roles after being cleared by the BCCI's Centre of Excellence. Previously limited to batting due to a fractured finger, Samson will lead the team in their next match against Punjab Kings on April 5.

title: Amazon CEO at Town Hall: 'Way to get ahead at Amazon is not to … '
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy emphasized that advancement at the company is based on achieving more with fewer resources, not building large teams. Jassy highlighted Amazon's commitment to agility and meritocracy, stressing customer impact and reducing bureaucracy as key factors in success. He urged employees to act quickly and innovate.

title: 'Can’t be a dumping ground’: Now, Calcutta HC lawyers protest Delhi judge transfer
content: Three lawyers' bodies of Calcutta HC decided to boycott the swearing-in of Justice Dinesh Kumar Sharma, protesting his transfer from Delhi HC. They argued the transfer undermines the court's integrity due to allegations of impropriety against Justice Sharma.

title: After juice vendor, now sanitation worker in UP gets Rs 34 crore I-T notice
content: A sanitation worker in Aligarh, UP, earning Rs 15,000 monthly, received an income tax notice for Rs 34 crore, suggesting his PAN card was misused. Karan Kumar, who learned of the notice on March 29, filed a police complaint. I-T officials plan to investigate the misuse cases through faceless assessments.

title: Haldiram's Rs 56,000 crore stake sale has a 'SpaceX’ angle to it
content: Haldiram's has sold a 6% stake to UAE-based Alpha Wave for Rs 5,600 crore, following a 9% stake sale to Temasek. The deals have valued the iconic snack brand at Rs 84,000 crore, setting the stage for an IPO within a year.

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal to move to Goa from Mumbai
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal, India’s Test opener, is making a significant shift from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025-26 season, where he will serve as captain. Despite his deep roots in Mumbai cricket, Jaiswal seeks a No-Objection Certificate to officially make the move.

title: Amazon, & others warn Indian H-1B holders to avoid travel amid visa rules
content: Indian tech workers, primarily on H-1B visas, face growing uncertainty under the Trump administration's immigration policies. Major tech firms like Amazon and Google advise employees to avoid international travel to prevent re-entry issues. The Green Card process for Indians is experiencing significant delays, adding to the anxiety despite President Trump's mixed messages on H-1B visas.

title: Unprecedented CCP shake-up: Xi’s inner circle gets a jolt
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping has unexpectedly swapped roles of Politburo members Li Ganjie and Shi Taifeng. This significant move, seen as part of Xi’s strategy to consolidate power ahead of the 2027 party congress, puts Li in charge of the United Front Work Department and Shi the Organisation Department, signaling Xi’s ongoing drive to eliminate rivals and reinforce loyalty.

title: Rabada EXCLUSIVE: 'Even a No. 10 can hit a six... there's no real mystery'
content: Nicholas Pooran is leading with an impressive strike rate and six count, making IPL 2024 a high-scoring season. Kagiso Rabada discusses the challenges for bowlers, the Impact Player rule, and shares his experience with coach Ashish Nehra and the upcoming WTC final.

title: Israel to seize 'large areas' of Gaza, military vows to 'crush and clean terrorists'
content: Israel is intensifying its military operations in Gaza to reclaim significant areas and enhance security zones. This comes in response to ongoing conflict with Hamas. Israeli defence minister Katz emphasized the objective of eliminating terrorist threats and stressed the evacuation of civilians from affected regions.

title: MNS targets Maharashtra govt over flyover delay with 'Kunal Kamra' banners
content: MNS criticized the Maharashtra govt for delays in constructing two flyovers on Kalyan Sheel Road, with prank banners featuring comedian Kunal Kamra. The project's slow pace since 2018 has caused major traffic jams. A political tussle ensued as local politicians from MNS and Shiv Sena traded barbs using the banners. Kamra faces FIR for remarks about Dy CM Shinde.

title: 15 FAQs to explain all you need to know on Waqf Bill
content: The central government plans to table the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024 in Parliament, amidst opposition resistance. The bill seeks to improve the administration of Waqf properties, introduce technology-driven management, address legal complexities, and ensure transparency and accountability in Waqf management while incorporating key reforms.

title: 'Sikandar' box office collection: Salman Khan starrer expected to see a further drop
content: Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' had a decent start at the box office, opening at Rs 26 crore. It saw growth on Eid with Rs 29 crore but dropped by 32% on day 3. Its total collection is Rs 75.49 crore.

title: After pastor Bajinder Singh’s sentencing, rape survivor faints outside courtroom
content: Evangelical Christian pastor Bajinder Singh has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a woman in 2018. He was also fined Rs 1 lakh. The court announced the punishment after convicting him. Singh previously served time for a murder case. The woman expressed satisfaction with the verdict. Other accused persons were acquitted due to insufficient evidence.

title: Val Kilmer, iconic star of ‘Top Gun’ and ‘Batman Forever,’ passes away at 65
content: Val Kilmer, famous for his roles in 'Top Gun' and 'Batman Forever,' has died at 65. His daughter confirmed he died of pneumonia on April 1. Kilmer battled throat cancer for years. His major roles included Jim Morrison in 'The Doors' and Batman in 'Batman Forever.' He is survived by his two children, Mercedes and Jack.

title: Man found dead in UP's Amroha after confronting wife and her lover
content: A 30-year-old man, Sheeshpal, was found hanging in his home in Hasanpur following a conflict with his wife, Santosh Devi, over her alleged affair with a former village head, Rajendra Kumar. An FIR has been filed, and Santosh, along with Rajendra, has been detained for interrogation.

title: Why is early diagnosis of Autism still a challenge in India?
content: Early diagnosis and intervention are crucial for managing Autistic Spectrum Disorder (ASD), improving cognitive and social-emotional functions in affected children. Despite no specific biomarker test available, observation of behaviour is essential. In India, challenges such as lack of acceptance, cultural differences, and high cost hinder early diagnosis. Multidisciplinary approaches and parental involvement are vital for effective management.

title: Former Nigerian boxing champion Gabriel Olanrewaju dies after collapsing during fight
content: Nigerian boxing champion Gabriel Olanrewaju tragically died after collapsing during a fight in Ghana. The 40-year-old lost consciousness in the third round and later died in the hospital, raising concerns over the bout's organization and approval.

title: From 6 months to 80 years old, home cracker unit blast claims 8 of Bengal family
content: Eight members of the Banik family in South 24 Parganas died following a blast at their illegal fireworks factory. Two surviving family members, who ran the business, face serious charges. Investigations are ongoing to determine the cause and legality of the operations. Police plan stricter regulations for firework factories to prevent such tragedies in the future.

title: 6 financial changes from April 1 you should know
content: Starting April 1, 2025, changes in income tax slabs, UPI rules, and TDS thresholds will take effect. The highest tax rate of 30% applies to income above Rs 24 lakh. TDS thresholds for interest income have been increased. The Unified Pension Scheme begins and existing small savings scheme rates remain unchanged.

title: Siddhivinayak's annual revenue rises to record Rs 133 crore
content: The Siddhivinayak temple trust in Prabhadevi reported record earnings of Rs 133 crore for the financial year 2024-25, a 15% increase from the previous year. Effective administration and efficient darshan arrangements contributed to the increase, with revenues from donations, prasad sales, and gold-silver offerings.

title: Cops force banker to cut short vacation to join Kamra probe
content: A 46-year-old banker from Navi Mumbai was forced to return from his holiday early due to calls from the police regarding his witness statement in a defamation case against comedian Kunal Kamra. The case involves Kamra's video that allegedly defamed Maharashtra's deputy CM, leading to an FIR.

title: How has Trump tariff threats on Russia impacted India’s purchases?
content: In March, Indian refiners increased US crude oil imports by 66% amidst US President Trump's push for American energy exports. Incidentally, Russian oil imports to India also rose due to suppliers circumventing US sanctions.

title: Right to shelter fundamental, pay Rs10L for each bulldozed home: SC
content: The Supreme Court of India mandated the Prayagraj Development Authority to compensate five homeowners, whose houses were unlawfully demolished in 2021, with Rs 10 lakh each. The court emphasized that the right to shelter is a fundamental right and must be protected under the rule of law.

title: Photos: Another Pant- Goenka post-match chat after PBKS thrash LSG
content: Punjab Kings won their second consecutive match in the IPL, defeating Lucknow Super Giants by eight wickets. PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer scored a match-winning fifty. LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka was seen conversing with Iyer and Rishabh Pant. Lucknow are still trying to adapt to their home conditions and will face Mumbai Indians next.

title: Australian left stunned after doctor used ChatGPT for medical advice
content: A woman in Perth reported feeling shocked and disrespected when her doctor used ChatGPT to analyze her test results, calling it unprofessional. The incident has been reported to regulatory authorities, prompting debate over the use of AI tools in healthcare.

title: Pat McAfee, ESPN accused of spreading false scandal that ‘destroyed’ Ole Miss student
content: Mary Kate Cornett, an 18-year-old Ole Miss student, is taking legal action against ESPN's Pat McAfee for spreading false rumors about an affair, leading to harassment and ruining her life. The scandal originated on social media and was amplified by McAfee on his show, causing Cornett severe emotional distress and disrupting her college life.

title: No liquor sale in 19 holy cities of Madhya Pradesh, ban comes into effect
content: Devotees can no longer buy liquor in Ujjain for offerings at Kal Bhairav temple due to a new ban. Liquor sales within Ujjain municipal limits have ceased, closing all shops and bars. However, devotees can still carry legally purchased liquor from outside the city. The temple will maintain a two-day stock of liquor for rituals.

title: Soros-funded desi company also got Rs 8 crore from USAID: ED
content: The US Agency for International Development (USAID) is under scrutiny in an ongoing investigation related to hedge fund operator George Soros. ASAR Social Impact Advisors received Rs 8 crore from USAID as foreign inward remittance while also being funded by the Soros Economic Development Fund.

title: 'Turning art into crime': Kunal Kamra on summons to audience as he gets 3rd notice
content: Khar police have recorded statements from individuals present when comedian Kunal Kamra's show was recorded, following Shiv Sena's FIR against Kamra for his 'Naya Bharat' video. Kamra has received police notices for questioning, while the audience members are also being summoned. Kamra criticizes the targeting of artists and has interim relief from arrest until an April 7 hearing.

title: Why did wife of UP man who arranged her marriage with lover return in 4 days
content: In Sant Kabir Nagar, a man arranged his wife's marriage to her lover, fearing for his safety. However, four days later, the woman's new mother-in-law sent her back to the first husband, sympathizing with his struggle of raising their children alone.

title: Democratic US senator ends 25-hour anti-Trump speech, longest in history
content: Senator Cory Booker from New Jersey delivered a 25-hour and 4-minute speech in the Senate, breaking a record. He condemned the Trump administration's policies and emphasized the urgent threats they pose. Booker remained standing throughout, joined occasionally by other Democratic senators. His speech gained massive online attention and received praise for its endurance and dedication.

title: 'Top gun' fame actor Val Kilmer passes away at 65
content: Val Kilmer, renowned actor known for his roles in 'Top Gun' and 'Batman Forever,' passed away at the age of 65 due to pneumonia. Kilmer had battled throat cancer for years, but his contributions to Hollywood, including a memorable return in 'Top Gun: Maverick,' remain impactful.

title: Gujarat godown tragedy: Operator was held a year ago for IPL betting
content: A massive explosion at an illegal firecracker godown in Deesa, Banaskantha, killed 21 people, including four children, with most victims buried under debris. The accident, caused by unauthorized storage and manufacturing of firecrackers, led to the arrest of warehouse operators Khoobchand Thakkar and his son Deepak. Authorities are taking strict legal actions.

title: 5 dead in bus-SUV collision in Maharashtra's Buldhana
content: Five people lost their lives in a major accident involving an MSRTC bus, a Bolero SUV, and a private bus on the Khamgaon-Shegaon highway in Buldhana, Maharashtra. Rescue operations continue to free the trapped private bus driver, while police investigate the cause and assess further casualties.

title: NBA coaching carousel: What's next for the Grizzlies and Kings jobs?
content: the Memphis Grizzlies fired longtime coach Taylor Jenkins on friday . there are two open head coaching jobs with two weeks to go in the regular season . this year's coaching carousel looks at the pros and cons of each vacancy .

title: Our annual mock draft with 32 first-round trades: Deals for Kirk Cousins, Micah Parsons
content: the mock draft of trades is a chance to put together my most ridiculous and enjoyable column of the year . most mocks have no trades, because as hard as it is to predict where players will actually end up, it's downright impossible to project which teams will make moves up and down and impact the draft order . the vast majority of the first 32 picks aren't in the universe in which the no. 2 pick gets traded .

title: 'Nokia': Shai Gilgeous-Alexander makes cameo in Drake music video
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made a cameo in Drake's "Nokia" music video . he appeared at the 2:37 mark in the video with colorways of his new signature Converse sneaker around his neck . the Oklahoma City guard shares the same birthplace as Drake: Ontario, Canada .

title: 17-Year-Old Killed By A Friend In Punjab Over iPhone 11
content: Navjot Singh's body was found in two parts, split from the stomach . police found that he was killed by his friend over the iphone 11 he owned . the mobile was recovered from his friend, amanjot, who was arrested .

title: "Things Have Changed, I Was Captain, Now...": Rohit On Mumbai Indians Role
content: Rohit Sharma is one of the most successful players in the history of the Indian Premier League . he was the captain of the franchise before the Mumbai Indians decided to promote Hardik Pandya to the role . the vice-captain's role was allotted to Suryakumar Yadav .
